greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = product of distinct primes of form 4k+1 that divide n.
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
maple: a:= n-> mul (i, i=map (x-> x[1], select (x-> isprime (x[1]) and irem (x[1], 4)=1, ifactors(n)[2]))): seq (a(n), n=1..120);
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 22 2009
ext: Corrected and extended with Maple program by _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 23 2009
